result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Wesley Jones

defendant.name: Jones, Joseph Wesley
defendant.address: Cross Roads Care Center 3216 West Highland Bouleva, Milwaukee, WI 53208

records.addlTxt: Upon request from Mendota, Court RESCHEDULED Doctor's Report Return to November 11, 2022 at 11:00 AM.  State will submit an Order to Produce.  Parties notified of court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Received and Filed: Competency Report Dated 10/31/22

Defendant Joseph Wesley Jones appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms in court for Joseph Wesley Jones.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney James C Griffin. 

Case in court for a return on Doctor's report.  Doctor's findings state the defendant is currently not competent to proceed but likely to restore competency within the permissible timeframe if treated at a state mental health institution.  Parties do not contest the Doctor's findings.  Court adopts the findings and continues to suspend proceedings.  Court scheduled a return on Doctor's report.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Joseph Wesley Jones not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Case scheduled for return on doctor report. Parties in receipt of report. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order of Commitment for Treatment, signed

Defendant Joseph Wesley Jones in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Joseph Wesley Jones in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Defense is challenging the recommendation for involuntary medication order. Arguments as to defense competency of Dr. Seipel ability to testify due to lack of qualifications. Court allows testimony. Prior to testimony, Court makes finding that defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within the statutory time frame.  Court orders proceedings suspended.

Sworn for the State: Dr. Seipel. Defense objections argued. Testimony continued. State informs the court that it no longer wishes to go forward with testimony and agrees with defense. 

Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency. Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.

Case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report in Branch 2.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph Wesley Jones in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant appears via Zoom.   Doctor's report received and filed.  State does not contest findings, however Defense contest findings and requests a hearing. Case scheduled for competency hearing , Branch 2 via Zoom.  Competency hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph Wesley Jones not in court, defendant in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for status of counsel. SPD has not yet appointed counsel. Case rescheduled off the record. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph Wesley Jones not in court, defendant in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Doctor's Report Return. Defendant not produced. State requests a shortened Status of Counsel date to have Attorney Reed present, due to the defendant's raised compentency. Case adjourned to Br 02.  Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Defendant Joseph Wesley Jones in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Joseph Wesley Jones in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph Wesley Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
